datafield.subfield: DEM Analysis of Small-Displacement Earth Pressure Against a Rigid Retaining Wall with the Wall Moving Towards Structured Sand

This paper numerically investigated the earth pressure evolution against the rigid retaining wall by two-dimensional Distinct Element Method (DEM) as the wall moves towards structured sand with small displacement, as well as shear strain progress and bond breakage distribution. For the effect of bond on mechanical behaviors of structured sand, a bond contact model considering bond thickness was used. Under three various wall movements, the responses in three structured sands with three sets of bond parameters are compared with those in pure sand of same void ratio in DEM analysis. The DEM results show that with the increase of bond strength, earth pressure increases and shear strain decreases at the same displacement, which indicates that cementation of structured sand can effectively resist retaining wall from moving towards soil. The localized shear strain begins to form at the toe or top of retaining wall under different movement, where the bond breakage is concentrated, especially tensile-shear bond breakage.
